jibe.sdk.client.simple
Interface SimpleConnection

All Superinterfaces:
SimpleApi
All Known Implementing Classes:
AudioCallConnection, DatagramSocketConnection, FileTransferConnection, JibeBundleTransferConnection, OneWayVideoSharingConnection, VideoCallConnection
public interface SimpleConnection
extends SimpleApi

Base interface, implemented by all connection classes in jibe.sdk.client.simple.*.

Method Detail

start

void start(java.lang.String receiverUserId)
           throws java.io.IOException,
                  java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                  java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                  JibeServiceException
Opens a SIP-session-based connection to a remote user. Returns immediately. SimpleConnectionStateListener has to be used, to detect when the connection has been started, or if the connection request fails.

Parameters:
receiverUserId - The phone number/SIP URI of user you are trying to connect (e.g. +491235678 or (408) 345-6789)
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is a problem with the network connection
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the remote userId is not a valid phone number of at least 3 digits
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the SimpleConnection class is not idle any more (e.g. already STARTED or DISPOSED) or not initialized yet
JibeServiceException - if there is a problem communication with the Jibe Realtime Engine (an Android background service)

start

void start(Intent intent)
           throws java.io.IOException,
                  SessionNotFoundException,
                  java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                  java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                  JibeServiceException
Starts connection from an intent and returns immediately. Sender side intent (user selects "challenge" inside Jibe Arena): jibe.sdk.client.JibeIntents.ACTION_ARENA_CHALLENGE Receiver side intent: depending on the type of SimpleConnection being used such as: jibe.sdk.client.JibeIntents.ACTION_INCOMING_DATASESSION jibe.sdk.client.JibeIntents.ACTION_INCOMING_CALL jibe.sdk.client.JibeIntents.ACTION_INCOMING_FILETRANSFER If you want to start a connection directly with a phone number or SIP URI on the sender side, see start(String) SimpleConnectionStateListener has to be used, to detect when the connection has been started, or if the connection request fails.

Parameters:
intent - Intent with which to start the connection
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is a problem with the network connection
SessionNotFoundException - when trying to operate on a session which no longer exists.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the SimpleConnection class is not idle any more (e.g. already STARTED or DISPOSED) or not initialized yet
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the type of the incoming connection from the passed in intent cannot be handled by this class.
JibeServiceException - if there is a problem communication with the Jibe Realtime Engine (an Android background service)

reject

void reject(Intent incomingIntent)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   SessionNotFoundException,
                   java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                   java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                   JibeServiceException
Rejects an incoming connection.

Parameters:
incomingIntent - Intent which was thrown to notify the client about the incoming connection request.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is a problem with the network connection
SessionNotFoundException - when trying to operate on a session which no longer exists.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the SimpleConnection class is already STARTED, DISPOSED or not initialized yet
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the type of the incoming connection from the passed in intent cannot be handled by this class.
JibeServiceException - if there is a problem communication with the Jibe Realtime Engine (an Android background service)

monitor

void monitor(Intent incomingIntent)
             throws java.io.IOException,
                    SessionNotFoundException,
                    java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                    JibeServiceException
Monitor an incoming connection. The listener will receive events for this connection without making changes to its state.

Parameters:
incomingIntent - Intent which was thrown to notify the client about the incoming connection request.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is a problem with the network connection
SessionNotFoundException - when trying to operate on a session which no longer exists.
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the SimpleConnection class is not idle any more (e.g. already STARTED or DISPOSED) or not initialized yet
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the type of the incoming connection from the passed in intent cannot be handled by this class.
JibeServiceException - if there is a problem communication with the Jibe Realtime Engine (an Android background service)

stop

void stop()
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 SessionNotFoundException,
                 JibeServiceException
Closes the connection and all of the resources that it uses.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is a problem with the network connection
SessionNotFoundException - when trying to operate on a session which no longer exists.
JibeServiceException - if there is a problem communication with the Jibe Realtime Engine (an Android background service)

isStarted

boolean isStarted()
Checks whether the connection has been established successfully, end-to-end, in which case all signaling has been set up, and media data is ready to flow.

Returns:
true, if connected.

getState

SimpleConnection.State getState()
Returns the state of the current connection as defined in SimpleConnection.State

setAutoAccept

void setAutoAccept(boolean autoAccept)
Specify whether incoming connections should be automatically accepted. Note that incoming calls will only be auto-accepted if there isn't already another call in progress.

The application's ID needs to be set, via Config.setAppToAppIdentifier(String, String) , before enabling the auto-accept feature.

Parameters:
autoAccept - Set to true, in order to automatically accept incoming connections.

canProcessIntent

boolean canProcessIntent(Intent incomingIntent)
Checks whether a given intent matches this type of simple connection. Can be used to update the application UI upon valid incoming intents prior to calling start(Intent) or reject(Intent)

Parameters:
incomingIntent -
Returns:
true, if the intent matches this type of connection.

getSessionId

long getSessionId()
Returns the ID of the SIP session underpinning the connection, for use with the low-level APIs.

Returns:
The current sessionId .

getRemoteUserId

java.lang.String getRemoteUserId()
Returns the userId (phone number/SIP URI) of the remote user.

Returns:
The userId.

getRemoteUserDisplayName

java.lang.String getRemoteUserDisplayName()
Returns the display name (if available) of the remote user.

Returns:
The display name of the remote user.
